result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Kwame R. Lowery. Defendant Kwame R. Lowery appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Shamali advises that there is still some discovery he needs to get and then review with the DE.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Attorney Christopher R. Bub in court with Defendant Kwame R. Lowery who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU 
  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

214PM   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am. mi

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: This event needed to open case.

Defendant Kwame R. Lowery in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:     SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Items received by the DE by mail
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

02:13 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State under supervision of Attorney Brost.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran. Clerk PU.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:45 am. Warrant vacated. $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
Warrant returned from KCJ - In Custody
